text:
RLimitNPROC X Y shoud suspend process when user runs = X PHP scripts or Y all his process.

But it seems that it does not work. Example:

RLimitNPROC 3 10 limit shoud show error 500 when user use 4 PHP scripts or 10 other process. But Apache will show error 500 also, when user runs only on process PHP, 1 connection FTP and 2 imap connection (at the same time). So, I think that HARD limit is completly ignored - only SOFT limit works (but as HARD).

Apache doesn't implement rlimit, that's a feature of your operating system. The soft limit is the one that's in effect at all time.  

From linux:

| The soft limit is the value that the kernel enforces for 
| the corresponding resource.
